*** Bug 180137 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

HEAD (April 2):
This exception has become very frequent. It now rivals NPE (bug 180063) in terms of frequency.

Created an attachment (id=62697)
proposed patch

Patch ensures that if a typedef is encountered as a specialized base class, the root class type is used instead.

Sergey, there's something about the code you are working with that just brings
out the worst in my work :).  Thanks for taking the time to log these pesky
exceptions...
It's not a small code base, I must admit ;-).

With the patch the ClassCastExceptions are gone. I'm now getting a lot of new NPEs:

The indexing speed improved quite dramatically. Is it a bad sign?
I am guessing that I've already fixed this in my workspace (like Bug #180063).  Do you encounter this exception with the same test case from Bug #180063?
Sergey, can you check if you are still getting either exception with the latest from head?
Marking as fixed since this exception does not happen any more with HEAD.
I've created bug 181015 to track remaining indexer exceptions.
Setting to milestone 4.0 so we can generate a report of all bugs fixed in 4.0.
